017package org.apache.commons.chain;
018
019import java.util.Iterator;
020import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
021
022import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogFactoryBase;
023import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
024import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
025
026/**
027 * A {@link CatalogFactory} is a class used to store and retrieve
028 * {@link Catalog}s. The factory allows for a default {@link Catalog}
029 * as well as {@link Catalog}s stored with a name key. Follows the
030 * Factory pattern (see GoF).
031 *
032 * <p>The base {@code CatalogFactory} implementation also implements
033 * a resolution mechanism which allows lookup of a command based on a single
034 * String which encodes both the catalog and command names.</p>
035 *
036 * @param <C> Type of the context associated with this command
037 *
038 * @author Sean Schofield
039 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
040 */
041public abstract class CatalogFactory<C extends Context> {
042
043    // ------------------------------------------------------- Static Variables
044
045    /**
046     * Values passed to the {@code getCommand(String)} method should
047     * use this as the delimiter between the "catalog" name and the "command"
048     * name.
049     */
050    public static final String DELIMITER = ":";
051
052    /**
053     * The set of registered {@link CatalogFactory} instances,
054     * keyed by the relevant class loader.
055     */
056    private static final ConcurrentHashMap<ClassLoader, CatalogFactory<?>> FACTORIES = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
057
058    // --------------------------------------------------------- Public Methods
059
060    /**
061     * Gets the default instance of Catalog associated with the factory
062     * (if any); otherwise, return {@code null}.
063     *
064     * @return the default Catalog instance
065     */
066    public abstract Catalog<C> getCatalog();
067
068    /**
069     * Sets the default instance of Catalog associated with the factory.
070     *
071     * @param catalog the default Catalog instance
072     */
073    public abstract void setCatalog(Catalog<C> catalog);
074
075    /**
076     * Retrieves a Catalog instance by name (if any); otherwise
077     * return {@code null}.
078     *
079     * @param name the name of the Catalog to retrieve
080     *
081     * @return the specified Catalog
082     */
083    public abstract Catalog<C> getCatalog(String name);
084
085    /**
086     * Adds a named instance of Catalog to the factory (for subsequent
087     * retrieval later).
088     *
089     * @param name the name of the Catalog to add
090     * @param catalog the Catalog to add
091     */
092    public abstract void addCatalog(String name, Catalog<C> catalog);
093
094    /**
095     * Return an {@code Iterator} over the set of named
096     * {@link Catalog}s known to this {@link CatalogFactory}.
097     * If there are no known catalogs, an empty Iterator is returned.
098     *
099     * @return An Iterator of the names of the Catalogs known by this factory.
100     */
101    public abstract Iterator<String> getNames();
102
103    /**
104     * Return a {@code Command} based on the given commandID.
105     *
106     * <p>At this time, the structure of commandID is relatively simple: if the
107     * commandID contains a DELIMITER, treat the segment of the commandID
108     * up to (but not including) the DELIMITER as the name of a catalog, and the
109     * segment following the DELIMITER as a command name within that catalog.
110     * If the commandID contains no DELIMITER, treat the commandID as the name
111     * of a command in the default catalog.</p>
112     *
113     * <p>To preserve the possibility of future extensions to this lookup
114     * mechanism, the DELIMITER string should be considered reserved, and
115     * should not be used in command names. commandID values which contain
116     * more than one DELIMITER will cause an {@code IllegalArgumentException}
117     * to be thrown.</p>
118     *
119     * @param <CMD> the expected {@link Command} type to be returned
120     * @param commandID the identifier of the command to return
121     *
122     * @return the command located with commandID, or {@code null}
123     *         if either the command name or the catalog name cannot be
124     *         resolved
125     *
126     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the commandID contains more than
127     *         one DELIMITER
128     *
129     * @since Chain 1.1
130     */
131    public <CMD extends Command<C>> CMD getCommand(String commandID) {
132        String commandName = commandID;
133        String catalogName = null;
134        Catalog<C> catalog = null;
135
136        if (commandID != null) {
137            int splitPos = commandID.indexOf(DELIMITER);
138            if (splitPos != -1) {
139                catalogName = commandID.substring(0, splitPos);
140                commandName = commandID.substring(splitPos + DELIMITER.length());
141                if (commandName.contains(DELIMITER)) {
142                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("commandID ["
143                            + commandID + "] has too many delimiters (reserved for future use)");
144                }
145            }
146        }
147
148        if (catalogName != null) {
149            catalog = this.getCatalog(catalogName);
150            if (catalog == null) {
151                Log log = LogFactory.getLog(CatalogFactory.class);
152                log.warn("No catalog found for name: " + catalogName + ".");
153                return null;
154            }
155        } else {
156            catalog = this.getCatalog();
157            if (catalog == null) {
158                Log log = LogFactory.getLog(CatalogFactory.class);
159                log.warn("No default catalog found.");
160                return null;
161            }
162        }
163
164        return catalog.getCommand(commandName);
165    }
166
167    // -------------------------------------------------------- Static Methods
168
169    /**
170     * Return the singleton {@link CatalogFactory} instance
171     * for the relevant {@code ClassLoader}. For applications
172     * that use a thread context class loader (such as web applications
173     * running inside a servet container), this will return a separate
174     * instance for each application, even if this class is loaded from
175     * a shared parent class loader.
176     *
177     * @param <C> Type of the context associated with this command
178     *
179     * @return the per-application singleton instance of {@link CatalogFactory}
180     */
181    public static <C extends Context> CatalogFactory<C> getInstance() {
182        ClassLoader cl = getClassLoader();
183
184        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
185        CatalogFactory<C> ret = (CatalogFactory<C>) FACTORIES.computeIfAbsent(cl, k -> new CatalogFactoryBase<>());
186        return ret;
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Clear all references to registered catalogs, as well as to the
191     * relevant class loader. This method should be called, for example,
192     * when a web application utilizing this class is removed from
193     * service, to allow for garbage collection.
194     */
195    public static void clear() {
196        FACTORIES.remove(getClassLoader());
197    }
198
199    // ------------------------------------------------------- Private Methods
200
201    /**
202     * Return the relevant {@code ClassLoader} to use as a Map key
203     * for this request. If there is a thread context class loader, return
204     * that; otherwise, return the class loader that loaded this class.
205     *
206     * @return the relevant {@code ClassLoader} to use as a Map key for this request
207     */
208    private static ClassLoader getClassLoader() {
209        ClassLoader cl = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
210        if (cl == null) {
211            cl = CatalogFactory.class.getClassLoader();
212        }
213        return cl;
214    }
215}
